page.title: 03RELIGION IN WESTONING
page.content: There are three{churches}in Westoning.{St Mary's Parish Church serves the Church of England parishioners and has an active branch of the{Mothers Union. There is a{Methodist Church}in the High Street whose parishioners hold regular coffe mornings. There is also a{Baptist Church.} The family of a former vicar of St Mary's, the Campions, were very influential in Westoning. In 1897, J.G.Coventry Campion commissioned the building of the{Clock Tower}in the High Street to commemorate the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Victoria.
